title.raw: 《燕召公世家》 House of Yan Shaogong

sentences.zh: 召公奭與周同姓，姓姬氏。

translations.literal: Duke of Shao Shi shared the same surname with Zhou, surname Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi shared the same surname with the Zhou, the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 周武王之滅紂，封召公於北燕。

translations.literal: When King Wu of Zhou destroyed Zhou, he enfeoffed the Duke of Shao at Northern Yan.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou destroyed King Zhou, he enfeoffed the Duke of Shao at Northern Yan.

sentences.zh: 其在成王時，召王為三公：自陜以西，召公主之；

translations.literal: During King Cheng's time, the Duke of Shao was one of the three dukes: from Shan westwards, the Duke of Shao governed it;
translations.idiomatic: During King Cheng's time, the Duke of Shao was one of the three dukes: from Shan westwards, the Duke of Shao governed it;

sentences.zh: 自陜以東，周公主之。

translations.literal: From Shan eastwards, the Duke of Zhou governed it.
translations.idiomatic: From Shan eastwards, the Duke of Zhou governed it.

sentences.zh: 成王既幼，周公攝政，當國踐祚，召公疑之，作君奭。

translations.literal: King Cheng was still young, the Duke of Zhou acted as regent, managed the state and ascended the throne. The Duke of Shao suspected him, and composed the Jun Shi.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was still young, so the Duke of Zhou acted as regent, managing the state and ascending the throne. The Duke of Shao suspected him and composed the Jun Shi.

sentences.zh: 君奭不說周公。

translations.literal: Jun Shi was not pleased with the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jun Shi expressed displeasure with the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公乃稱「湯時有伊尹，假于皇天；

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou then said: "In Tang's time there was Yi Yin, who relied on the August Heaven;
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then said: "In Tang's time there was Yi Yin, who relied on the August Heaven;

sentences.zh: 在太戊時，則有若伊陟、臣扈，假于上帝，巫咸治王家；

translations.literal: In Tai Wu's time, there were Yi Zhi and Chen Hu, who relied on the Supreme Deity. Wu Xian governed the royal house;
translations.idiomatic: In Tai Wu's time, there were Yi Zhi and Chen Hu, who relied on the Supreme Deity. Wu Xian governed the royal house;

sentences.zh: 在祖乙時，則有若巫賢；

translations.literal: In Zu Yi's time, there was Wu Xian;
translations.idiomatic: In Zu Yi's time, there was Wu Xian;

sentences.zh: 在武丁時，則有若甘般：率維茲有陳，保乂有殷」。

translations.literal: In Wu Ding's time, there was Gan Ban: leading and maintaining these arrangements, protecting and governing Yin."
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Ding's time, there was Gan Ban, who led and maintained these arrangements, protecting and governing the state of Yin."

sentences.zh: 於是召公乃說。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Duke of Shao was pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Duke of Shao was pleased.

sentences.zh: 召公之治西方，甚得兆民和。

translations.literal: The Duke of Shao's governance of the western regions greatly won the harmony of the myriad people.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao's governance of the western regions greatly won the harmony of the myriad people.

sentences.zh: 召公巡行鄉邑，有棠樹，決獄政事其下，自侯伯至庶人各得其所，無失職者。

translations.literal: The Duke of Shao traveled through villages and towns. There was a pear tree, and he decided legal cases and government affairs beneath it. From marquesses and earls down to commoners, each obtained their proper place, and none failed in their duties.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao traveled through villages and towns. There was a pear tree, and he decided legal cases and government affairs beneath it. From marquesses and earls down to commoners, each obtained their proper place, and none failed in their duties.

sentences.zh: 召公卒，而民人思召公之政，懷棠樹不敢伐，哥詠之，作甘棠之詩。

translations.literal: When the Duke of Shao died, the people remembered the Duke of Shao's governance, cherished the pear tree and did not dare to cut it down, sang and chanted of it, and composed the poem "Sweet Pear."
translations.idiomatic: When the Duke of Shao died, the people remembered the Duke of Shao's governance, cherished the pear tree and did not dare to cut it down, sang and chanted of it, and composed the poem "Sweet Pear."

sentences.zh: 自召公已下九世至惠侯。

translations.literal: From the Duke of Shao down, nine generations reached Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: From the Duke of Shao down, nine generations reached Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 燕惠侯當周厲王奔彘，共和之時。

translations.literal: Yan's Duke Hui was contemporary with Zhou's King Li fleeing to Zhi, the Gonghe period.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui of Yan was contemporary with the period when King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, during the Gonghe era.

sentences.zh: 惠侯卒，子釐侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Hui died, his son Duke Xi succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Xi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，周宣王初即位。

translations.literal: That year, Zhou's King Xuan first ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: That year, King Xuan of Zhou first ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 釐侯二十一年，鄭桓公初封於鄭。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's twenty-first year, Zheng's Duke Huan was first enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year of Duke Xi's reign, Duke Huan of Zheng was first enfeoffed at Zheng.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，釐侯卒，子頃侯立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, his son Duke Qing succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Qing succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 頃侯二十年，周幽王淫亂，為犬戎所弒。

translations.literal: In Duke Qing's twentieth year, Zhou's King You was licentious and disorderly, was assassinated by the Quan Rong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year of Duke Qing's reign, King You of Zhou was licentious and disorderly and was assassinated by the Quan Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin first ranked among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin first became ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，頃侯卒，子哀侯立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Qing died, his son Duke Ai succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Qing died, and his son Duke Ai succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年卒，子鄭侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Ai died in his second year, his son Duke Zheng succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai died in the second year of his reign, and his son Duke Zheng succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 鄭侯三十六年卒，子繆侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Zheng died in his thirty-sixth year, his son Duke Mu succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zheng died in the thirty-sixth year of his reign, and his son Duke Mu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 繆侯七年，而魯隱公元年也。

translations.literal: Duke Mu's seventh year, and Lu's Duke Yin's first year.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of Duke Mu's reign, which was also the first year of Duke Yin of Lu.

sentences.zh: 十八年卒，子宣侯立。

translations.literal: He died in his eighteenth year, his son Duke Xuan succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the eighteenth year of his reign, and his son Duke Xuan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 宣侯十三年卒，子桓侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan died in his thirteenth year, his son Duke Huan succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in the thirteenth year of his reign, and his son Duke Huan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 桓侯七年卒，子莊公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his seventh year, his son Duke Zhuang succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in the seventh year of his reign, and his son Duke Zhuang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 莊公十二年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhuang's twelfth year, Qi's Duke Huan first became hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year of Duke Zhuang's reign, Duke Huan of Qi first became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與宋、衛共伐周惠王，惠王出奔溫，立惠王弟穨為周王。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, together with Song and Wei, they attacked Zhou's King Hui. King Hui fled to Wen, and they established King Hui's younger brother Tui as King of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, together with Song and Wei, they attacked King Hui of Zhou. King Hui fled to Wen, and they established King Hui's younger brother Tui as King of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十七年，鄭執燕仲父而內惠王于周。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Zheng captured Yan Zhong Fu and restored King Hui to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Zheng captured Yan Zhong Fu and restored King Hui to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，山戎來侵我，齊桓公救燕，遂北伐山戎而還。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, the Mountain Rong came to invade us. Duke Huan of Qi rescued Yan, then went north to attack the Mountain Rong and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the Mountain Rong came to invade us. Duke Huan of Qi rescued Yan, then went north to attack the Mountain Rong and returned.

sentences.zh: 燕君送齊桓公出境，桓公因割燕所至地予燕，使燕共貢天子，如成周時職；

translations.literal: The Yan ruler escorted Duke Huan of Qi out of the border. Duke Huan then ceded the territory that Yan had reached to Yan, making Yan jointly pay tribute to the Son of Heaven, as in the duty during the time of Chengzhou;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan ruler escorted Duke Huan of Qi out of the border. Duke Huan then ceded the territory that Yan had reached to Yan, making Yan jointly pay tribute to the Son of Heaven, as in the duty during the time of Chengzhou;

sentences.zh: 使燕復修召公之法。

translations.literal: He made Yan restore the Duke of Shao's methods.
translations.idiomatic: He made Yan restore the Duke of Shao's methods.

sentences.zh: 三十三年卒，子襄公立。

translations.literal: He died in his thirty-third year, his son Duke Xiang succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the thirty-third year of his reign, and his son Duke Xiang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 襄公二十六年，晉文公為踐土之會，稱伯。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiang's twenty-sixth year, Jin's Duke Wen held the meeting at Jiantu and was called hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year of Duke Xiang's reign, Duke Wen of Jin held the meeting at Jiantu and was called hegemon.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦師敗于殽。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, the Qin army was defeated at Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, the Qin army was defeated at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Qin's Duke Mu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 四十年，襄公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: In the fortieth year, Duke Xiang died, Duke Huan succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the fortieth year, Duke Xiang died, and Duke Huan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 桓公十六年卒，宣公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his sixteenth year, Duke Xuan succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in the sixteenth year of his reign, and Duke Xuan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 宣公十五年卒，昭公立。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan died in his fifteenth year, Duke Zhao succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in the fifteenth year of his reign, and Duke Zhao succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 昭公十三年卒，武公立。

translations.literal: Duke Zhao died in his thirteenth year, Duke Wu succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao died in the thirteenth year of his reign, and Duke Wu succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 是歲晉滅三郤大夫。

translations.literal: That year, Jin destroyed the three Xi ministers.
translations.idiomatic: That year, Jin destroyed the three Xi ministers.

sentences.zh: 武公十九年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Duke Wu died in his nineteenth year, Duke Wen succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu died in the nineteenth year of his reign, and Duke Wen succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 文公六年卒，懿公立。

translations.literal: Duke Wen died in his sixth year, Duke Yi succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen died in the sixth year of his reign, and Duke Yi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 懿公元年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公。

translations.literal: In Duke Yi's first year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated his ruler Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Yi's reign, Cui Zhu of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 四年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: He died in his fourth year, his son Duke Hui succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the fourth year of his reign, and his son Duke Hui succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，齊高止來奔。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui's first year, Qi's Gao Zhi came fleeing.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Hui's reign, Gao Zhi of Qi came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 六年，惠公多寵姬，公欲去諸大夫而立寵姬宋，大夫共誅姬宋，惠公懼，奔齊。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Duke Hui had many favored concubines. The duke wished to remove the ministers and establish favored concubine Song. The ministers together executed concubine Song. Duke Hui feared and fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Duke Hui had many favored concubines. The duke wished to remove the ministers and establish favored concubine Song. The ministers together executed concubine Song, and Duke Hui, fearing for his life, fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 四年，齊高偃如晉，請共伐燕，入其君。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qi's Gao Yan went to Jin, requesting to jointly attack Yan and restore its ruler.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Gao Yan of Qi went to Jin, requesting to jointly attack Yan and restore its ruler.

sentences.zh: 晉平公許，與齊伐燕，入惠公。

translations.literal: Duke Ping of Jin agreed, and together with Qi attacked Yan, restoring Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping of Jin agreed, and together with Qi attacked Yan and restored Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公至燕而死。

translations.literal: Duke Hui reached Yan and died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui reached Yan and died.

sentences.zh: 燕立悼公。

translations.literal: Yan established Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: Yan established Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公七年卒，共公立。

translations.literal: Duke Dao died in his seventh year, Duke Gong succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao died in the seventh year of his reign, and Duke Gong succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 共公五年卒，平公立。

translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his fifth year, Duke Ping succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong died in the fifth year of his reign, and Duke Ping succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑，六卿始彊大。

translations.literal: Jin's ducal house was weak, the six ministers first became strong and great.
translations.idiomatic: The ducal house of Jin was weak, and the six ministers first became strong and powerful.

sentences.zh: 平公十八年，吳王闔閭破楚入郢。

translations.literal: In Duke Ping's eighteenth year, Wu's King He Lu defeated Chu and entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year of Duke Ping's reign, King Helu of Wu defeated Chu and entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 十九年卒，簡公立。

translations.literal: He died in his nineteenth year, Duke Jian succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the nineteenth year of his reign, and Duke Jian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 簡公十二年卒，獻公立。

translations.literal: Duke Jian died in his twelfth year, Duke Xian succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian died in the twelfth year of his reign, and Duke Xian succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 晉趙鞅圍范、中行於朝歌。

translations.literal: Jin's Zhao Yang besieged Fan and Zhonghang at Zhaoge.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang of Jin besieged Fan and Zhonghang at Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 獻公十二年，齊田常弒其君簡公。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's twelfth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his ruler Duke Jian.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year of Duke Xian's reign, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 十四年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Confucius died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Confucius died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，獻公卒，孝公立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died, Duke Xiao succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died, and Duke Xiao succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 孝公十二年，韓、魏、趙滅知伯，分其地，三晉彊。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiao's twelfth year, Han, Wei, and Zhao destroyed Zhi Bo, divided his territory. The Three Jin became strong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year of Duke Xiao's reign, Han, Wei, and Zhao destroyed Zhi Bo and divided his territory. The Three Jin became strong.

sentences.zh: 十五年，孝公卒，成公立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Duke Xiao died, Duke Cheng succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Xiao died, and Duke Cheng succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 成公十六年卒，湣公立。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng died in his sixteenth year, Duke Min succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Cheng died in the sixteenth year of his reign, and Duke Min succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 湣公三十一年卒，釐公立。

translations.literal: Duke Min died in his thirty-first year, Duke Xi succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Min died in the thirty-first year of his reign, and Duke Xi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，三晉列為諸侯。

translations.literal: That year, the Three Jin were ranked among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: That year, the Three Jin were ranked among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 釐公三十年，伐敗齊于林營。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's thirtieth year, they attacked and defeated Qi at Linying.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year of Duke Xi's reign, they attacked and defeated Qi at Linying.

sentences.zh: 釐公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: Duke Xi died, Duke Huan succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi died, and Duke Huan succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 桓公十一年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his eleventh year, Duke Wen succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in the eleventh year of his reign, and Duke Wen succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦獻公卒。

translations.literal: That year, Qin's Duke Xian died.
translations.idiomatic: That year, Duke Xian of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 秦益彊。

translations.literal: Qin became increasingly strong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin became increasingly strong.

sentences.zh: 文公十九年，齊威王卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's nineteenth year, Qi's King Wei died.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year of Duke Wen's reign, King Wei of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，蘇秦始來見，說文公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Su Qin first came to see and persuade Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Su Qin first came to see and persuade Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公予車馬金帛以至趙，趙肅侯用之。

translations.literal: Duke Wen gave him carriages, horses, gold, and silk to go to Zhao. Duke Su of Zhao employed him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen gave him carriages, horses, gold, and silk to go to the state of Zhao. Duke Su of Zhao employed him.

sentences.zh: 因約六國，為從長。

translations.literal: Thereupon he allied the six states and became leader of the vertical alliance.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he allied the six states and became leader of the vertical alliance.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王以其女為燕太子婦。

translations.literal: King Hui of Qin gave his daughter as wife to the Yan heir apparent.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Qin gave his daughter as wife to the Yan heir apparent.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，文公卒，太子立，是為易王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died. The heir apparent succeeded him. This is King Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died. The heir apparent succeeded him and became King Yi.

sentences.zh: 易王初立，齊宣王因燕喪伐我，取十城；

translations.literal: When King Yi first succeeded, King Xuan of Qi took advantage of Yan's mourning to attack us and took ten cities;
translations.idiomatic: When King Yi first succeeded, King Xuan of Qi took advantage of the mourning period in Yan to attack us and captured ten cities;

sentences.zh: 蘇秦說齊，使復歸燕十城。

translations.literal: Su Qin persuaded Qi to return the ten cities to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Su Qin persuaded Qi to return the ten cities to Yan.

sentences.zh: 十年，燕君為王。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, the Yan ruler became king.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the Yan ruler became king.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦與燕文公夫人私通，懼誅，乃說王使齊為反閒，欲以亂齊。

translations.literal: Su Qin had illicit relations with Duke Wen of Yan's wife. Fearing execution, he persuaded the king to send him to Qi as a double agent, wishing to cause disorder in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Su Qin had illicit relations with Duke Wen of Yan's wife. Fearing execution, he persuaded the king to send him to Qi as a double agent, wishing to cause disorder in Qi.

sentences.zh: 易王立十二年卒，子燕噲立。

translations.literal: King Yi succeeded for twelve years and died. His son Yan Kuai succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: King Yi reigned for twelve years and died. His son Yan Kuai succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 燕噲既立，齊人殺蘇秦。

translations.literal: After Yan Kuai succeeded, the people of Qi killed Su Qin.
translations.idiomatic: After Yan Kuai succeeded, the people of Qi killed Su Qin.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦之在燕，與其相子之為婚，而蘇代與子之交。

translations.literal: When Su Qin was in Yan, he formed a marriage alliance with the prime minister Zi Zhi, and Su Dai formed a friendship with Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: When Su Qin was in Yan, he formed a marriage alliance with the prime minister Zi Zhi, and Su Dai formed a friendship with Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 及蘇秦死，而齊宣王復用蘇代。

translations.literal: After Su Qin died, King Xuan of Qi again employed Su Dai.
translations.idiomatic: After Su Qin died, King Xuan of Qi again employed Su Dai.

sentences.zh: 燕噲三年，與楚、三晉攻秦，不勝而還。

translations.literal: In Yan Kuai's third year, together with Chu and the Three Jin, they attacked Qin but did not win and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Yan Kuai's reign, together with Chu and the Three Jin, they attacked Qin but did not win and returned.

sentences.zh: 子之相燕，貴重，主斷。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi served as prime minister of Yan. He was noble and important, and made decisions.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi served as prime minister of Yan. He was noble and important, and made all decisions.

sentences.zh: 蘇代為齊使於燕，燕王問曰：「齊王奚如？」

translations.literal: Su Dai served as envoy from Qi to Yan. The Yan king asked: "How is the King of Qi?"
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai served as an envoy from Qi to Yan. The Yan king asked: "What is the King of Qi like?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「必不霸。」

translations.literal: He replied: "He will certainly not become hegemon."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "He will certainly never become hegemon."

sentences.zh: 燕王曰：「何也？」

translations.literal: The Yan king said: "Why?"
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king asked: "Why is that?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不信其臣。」

translations.literal: He replied: "He does not trust his ministers."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "He does not trust his ministers."

sentences.zh: 蘇代欲以激燕王以尊子之也。

translations.literal: Su Dai wished to use this to stimulate the Yan king to honor Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai wished to use this to encourage the Yan king to honor Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 於是燕王大信子之。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Yan king greatly trusted Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Yan king came to greatly trust Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 子之因遺蘇代百金，而聽其所使。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi thereupon gave Su Dai one hundred pieces of gold and followed his instructions.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi thereupon gave Su Dai one hundred pieces of gold and did whatever Su Dai instructed.

sentences.zh: 鹿毛壽謂燕王：「不如以國讓相子之。

translations.literal: Lu Mao Shou said to the Yan king: "It would be better to yield the state to the prime minister Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Mao Shou said to the Yan king: "It would be better to yield the state to your prime minister Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 人之謂堯賢者，以其讓天下於許由，許由不受，有讓天下之名而實不失天下。

translations.literal: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. Xu You did not accept it, so Yao had the name of yielding the world but in reality did not lose the world.
translations.idiomatic: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. When Xu You did not accept it, Yao gained the reputation of yielding the world while in reality not losing it.

sentences.zh: 今王以國讓於子之，子之必不敢受，是王與堯同行也。」

translations.literal: Now if the king yields the state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi will certainly not dare to accept it. This means the king acts the same as Yao."
translations.idiomatic: Now if the king yields the state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi will certainly not dare to accept it. In this way, the king will have acted the same as Yao."

sentences.zh: 燕王因屬國於子之，子之大重。

translations.literal: The Yan king thereupon entrusted the state to Zi Zhi. Zi Zhi became greatly important.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king thereupon entrusted the state to Zi Zhi, and Zi Zhi became greatly important.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「禹薦益，已而以啟人為吏。

translations.literal: Someone said: "Yu recommended Yi, but then made Qi's people officials.
translations.idiomatic: Someone said: "Yu recommended Yi, but then made Qi's followers into the officials.

sentences.zh: 及老，而以啟人為不足任乎天下，傳之於益。

translations.literal: When he grew old, he considered Qi's people insufficient to take charge of the world and transmitted it to Yi.
translations.idiomatic: When he grew old, he considered Qi's followers insufficient to take charge of the world and transmitted it to Yi.

sentences.zh: 已而啟與交黨攻益，奪之。

translations.literal: Then Qi and his associates attacked Yi and seized it from him.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi and his associates attacked Yi and seized the throne from him.

sentences.zh: 天下謂禹名傳天下於益，已而實令啟自取之。

translations.literal: The world says that Yu in name transmitted the world to Yi, but in reality ordered Qi to take it himself.
translations.idiomatic: The world says that Yu in name transmitted the world to Yi, but in reality had Qi take it for himself.

sentences.zh: 今王言屬國於子之，而吏無非太子人者，是名屬子之而實太子用事也。」

translations.literal: Now the king says to entrust the state to Zi Zhi, but the officials are all the heir apparent's people. This means in name entrusting it to Zi Zhi, but in reality the heir apparent handles affairs."
translations.idiomatic: Now the king says to entrust the state to Zi Zhi, but all the officials are the heir apparent's people. This means in name entrusting it to Zi Zhi, but in reality the heir apparent handles affairs."

sentences.zh: 王因收印自三百石吏已上而效之子之。

translations.literal: The king thereupon collected the seals from officials of three hundred dan and above and gave them to Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The king thereupon collected the seals from officials of three hundred dan and above and gave them to Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 子之南面行王事，而噲老不聽政，顧為臣，國事皆決於子之。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi faced south and performed the king's duties, while Kuai, being old, did not handle government affairs and became a minister. All state affairs were decided by Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi faced south and performed the king's duties, while Kuai, being old, did not handle government affairs and became a minister. All state affairs were decided by Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 三年，國大亂，百姓恫恐。

translations.literal: In the third year, the state was in great disorder, and the common people were terrified.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the state was in great disorder, and the common people were terrified.

sentences.zh: 將軍市被與太子平謀，將攻子之。

translations.literal: General Shi Bei plotted with the heir apparent Ping to attack Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: General Shi Bei plotted with the heir apparent Ping to attack Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 諸將謂齊湣王曰：「因而赴之，破燕必矣。」

translations.literal: The generals said to King Min of Qi: "If we take advantage of this and go there, we will certainly destroy Yan."
translations.idiomatic: The generals said to King Min of Qi: "If we take advantage of this and go there, we will certainly destroy Yan."

sentences.zh: 齊王因令人謂燕太子平曰：「寡人聞太子之義，將廢私而立公，飭君臣之義，明父子之位。

translations.literal: The King of Qi thereupon sent someone to say to the Yan heir apparent Ping: "I have heard of the heir apparent's righteousness, that you will abolish the private and establish the public, rectify the righteousness between ruler and minister, and clarify the positions of father and son.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi thereupon sent someone to say to the Yan heir apparent Ping: "I have heard of the heir apparent's righteousness, that you will abolish the private and establish the public, rectify the righteousness between ruler and minister, and clarify the positions of father and son.

sentences.zh: 寡人之國小，不足以為先後。

translations.literal: My state is small and insufficient to serve as vanguard or rearguard.
translations.idiomatic: My state is small and insufficient to serve as vanguard or rearguard.

sentences.zh: 雖然，則唯太子所以令之。」

translations.literal: Even so, I will follow whatever the heir apparent commands."
translations.idiomatic: Even so, I will follow whatever the heir apparent commands."

sentences.zh: 太子因要黨聚眾，將軍市被圍公宮，攻子之，不克。

translations.literal: The heir apparent thereupon gathered his partisans and assembled the masses. General Shi Bei besieged the ducal palace and attacked Zi Zhi, but did not conquer him.
translations.idiomatic: The heir apparent thereupon gathered his partisans and assembled the masses. General Shi Bei besieged the ducal palace and attacked Zi Zhi, but did not conquer him.

sentences.zh: 將軍市被及百姓反攻太子平，將軍市被死，以徇。

translations.literal: General Shi Bei and the common people counterattacked the heir apparent Ping. General Shi Bei died and was displayed as a warning.
translations.idiomatic: General Shi Bei and the common people counterattacked the heir apparent Ping. General Shi Bei died and was displayed as a warning.

sentences.zh: 因搆難數月，死者數萬，眾人恫恐，百姓離志。

translations.literal: The conflict lasted for several months. Tens of thousands died, the masses were terrified, and the common people lost their will.
translations.idiomatic: The conflict lasted for several months. Tens of thousands died, the masses were terrified, and the common people lost their will.

sentences.zh: 孟軻謂齊王曰：「今伐燕，此文、武之時，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Meng Ke said to the King of Qi: "Now to attack Yan—this is the time of King Wen and King Wu. We must not miss it."
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ke said to the King of Qi: "Now to attack Yan—this is the time of King Wen and King Wu. We must not miss this opportunity."

sentences.zh: 王因令章子將五都之兵，以因北地之眾以伐燕。

translations.literal: The king thereupon ordered Zhang Zi to lead the troops of the five capitals, and together with the masses of the northern regions, to attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The king thereupon ordered Zhang Zi to lead the troops of the five capitals, and together with the masses of the northern regions, to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 士卒不戰，城門不閉，燕君噲死，齊大勝。

translations.literal: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed, the Yan ruler Kuai died, and Qi achieved a great victory.
translations.idiomatic: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed, the Yan ruler Kuai died, and Qi achieved a great victory.

sentences.zh: 燕子之亡二年，而燕人共立太子平，是為燕昭王。

translations.literal: Two years after Zi Zhi's death, the people of Yan together established the heir apparent Ping. This is King Zhao of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Two years after Zi Zhi's death, the people of Yan together established the heir apparent Ping, who became King Zhao of Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕昭王於破燕之後即位，卑身厚幣以招賢者。

translations.literal: King Zhao of Yan ascended the throne after Yan was destroyed. He humbled himself and offered generous gifts to recruit worthy men.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Yan ascended the throne after Yan was destroyed. He humbled himself and offered generous gifts to recruit worthy men.

sentences.zh: 謂郭隗曰：「齊因孤之國亂而襲破燕，孤極知燕小力少，不足以報。

translations.literal: He said to Guo Kui: "Qi took advantage of my state's disorder to attack and destroy Yan. I fully know that Yan is small and weak, insufficient to take revenge.
translations.idiomatic: He said to Guo Kui: "Qi took advantage of the disorder in my state to attack and destroy Yan. I fully know that Yan is small and weak, insufficient to take revenge.

sentences.zh: 然誠得賢士以共國，以雪先王之恥，孤之願也。

translations.literal: However, if I can truly obtain worthy men to share the state and avenge the former king's shame, that is my wish.
translations.idiomatic: However, if I can truly obtain worthy men to share the state and avenge the former king's shame, that is my wish.

sentences.zh: 先生視可者，得身事之。」

translations.literal: Sir, look for suitable ones, and I will personally serve them."
translations.idiomatic: Sir, look for suitable ones, and I will personally serve them."

sentences.zh: 郭隗曰：「王必欲致士，先從隗始。

translations.literal: Guo Kui said: "If the king must wish to attract scholars, start with Kui first.
translations.idiomatic: Guo Kui said: "If the king wishes to attract scholars, start with Kui first.

sentences.zh: 況賢於隗者，豈遠千里哉！」

translations.literal: How much more those worthier than Kui—would they consider a thousand li far?"
translations.idiomatic: How much more those worthier than Kui—would they consider a thousand li far?"

sentences.zh: 於是昭王為隗改筑宮而師事之。

translations.literal: Thereupon King Zhao built a new palace for Kui and served him as teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Zhao built a new palace for Kui and served him as teacher.

sentences.zh: 樂毅自魏往，鄒衍自齊往，劇辛自趙往，士爭趨燕。

translations.literal: Yue Yi came from Wei, Zou Yan came from Qi, Ju Xin came from Zhao. Scholars competed to go to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi came from Wei, Zou Yan came from Qi, and Ju Xin came from Zhao. The scholars competed to go to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕王噲死問孤，與百姓同甘苦。

translations.literal: After King Kuai of Yan died, he inquired about the orphaned and shared joys and sorrows with the common people.
translations.idiomatic: After King Kuai of Yan died, he inquired about the orphaned and shared joys and sorrows with the common people.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，燕國殷富，士卒樂軼輕戰，於是遂以樂毅為上將軍，與秦、楚、三晉合謀以伐齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the state of Yan was prosperous and wealthy. The soldiers were happy and eager for battle. Thereupon he made Yue Yi the supreme general and together with Qin, Chu, and the Three Jin, they plotted to attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the state of Yan was prosperous and wealthy. The soldiers were happy and eager for battle. Thereupon he made Yue Yi the supreme general and together with Qin, Chu, and the Three Jin, they plotted to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊兵敗，湣王出亡於外。

translations.literal: The Qi army was defeated, and King Min fled abroad.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi army was defeated, and King Min fled abroad.

sentences.zh: 燕兵獨追北，入至臨淄，盡取齊寶，燒其宮室宗廟。

translations.literal: The Yan army alone pursued the fleeing enemy, entered as far as Linzi, took all of Qi's treasures, and burned its palaces and ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan army alone pursued the fleeing enemy, entered as far as Linzi, took all of Qi's treasures, and burned its palaces and ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 齊城之不下者，獨唯聊、莒、即墨，其餘皆屬燕，六歲。

translations.literal: Of Qi's cities that did not fall, only Liao, Ju, and Jimo remained. All the rest belonged to Yan for six years.
translations.idiomatic: Of Qi's cities that did not fall, only Liao, Ju, and Jimo remained. All the rest belonged to Yan for six years.

sentences.zh: 武成王七年，齊田單伐我，拔中陽。

translations.literal: In King Wu Cheng's seventh year, Qi's Tian Dan attacked us and captured Zhongyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of King Wucheng's reign, Tian Dan of Qi attacked us and captured Zhongyang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦敗趙於長平四十餘萬。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Qin defeated Zhao at Changping, more than four hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qin defeated Zhao at Changping, killing more than four hundred thousand.

sentences.zh: 十四年，武成王卒，子孝王立。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, King Wu Cheng died, and his son King Xiao succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, King Wucheng died, and his son King Xiao succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 孝王元年，秦圍邯鄲者解去。

translations.literal: In King Xiao's first year, those who besieged Handan from Qin withdrew and left.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Xiao's reign, the Qin forces that had besieged Handan withdrew and left.

sentences.zh: 三年卒，子今王喜立。

translations.literal: He died in his third year, and his son the present king Xi succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the third year of his reign, and his son the present king Xi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 今王喜四年，秦昭王卒。

translations.literal: In the present king Xi's fourth year, King Zhao of Qin died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of the present king Xi's reign, King Zhao of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 燕王命相栗腹約歡趙，以五百金為趙王酒。

translations.literal: The Yan king ordered the prime minister Li Fu to make an alliance with Zhao, using five hundred pieces of gold for the King of Zhao's wine.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king ordered the prime minister Li Fu to make an alliance with Zhao, using five hundred pieces of gold for the King of Zhao's wine.

sentences.zh: 還報燕王曰：「趙王壯者皆死長平，其孤未壯，可伐也。」

translations.literal: He returned and reported to the Yan king, saying: "Zhao's strong men all died at Changping. Their orphans are not yet grown. We can attack them."
translations.idiomatic: He returned and reported to the Yan king, saying: "Zhao's strong men all died at Changping. Their orphans are not yet grown. We can attack them."

sentences.zh: 王召昌國君樂閒問之。

translations.literal: The king summoned the Lord of Changguo, Yue Jian, and asked him.
translations.idiomatic: The king summoned the Lord of Changguo, Yue Jian, and asked him.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「趙四戰之國，其民習兵，不可伐。」

translations.literal: He replied: "Zhao is a state that fights on four sides. Its people are experienced in warfare. We cannot attack them."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "Zhao is a state that fights on four sides. Its people are experienced in warfare. We cannot attack them."

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾以五而伐一。」

translations.literal: The king said: "I will attack with five against one."
translations.idiomatic: The king said: "I will attack with five against one."

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: He replied: "It cannot be done."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "It cannot be done."

sentences.zh: 燕王怒，群臣皆以為可。

translations.literal: The Yan king was angry. All the ministers considered it feasible.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king was angry. All the ministers considered it feasible.

sentences.zh: 卒起二軍，車二千乘，栗腹將而攻鄗，卿秦攻代。

translations.literal: He finally raised two armies with two thousand chariots. Li Fu led and attacked Hao, while Qing Qin attacked Dai.
translations.idiomatic: He finally raised two armies with two thousand chariots. Li Fu led one and attacked the city of Hao, while Qing Qin attacked the city of Dai.

sentences.zh: 唯獨大夫將渠謂燕王曰：「與人通關約交，以五百金飲人之王，使者報而反攻之，不祥，兵無成功。」

translations.literal: Only the grandee Jiang Qu said to the Yan king: "To open borders and make an alliance with someone, use five hundred pieces of gold to toast their king, have the envoy report back, and then attack them—this is inauspicious. The army will not succeed."
translations.idiomatic: Only the grandee Jiang Qu said to the Yan king: "To open borders and make an alliance with someone, use five hundred pieces of gold to toast their king, have the envoy report back, and then attack them—this is inauspicious. The army will not succeed."

sentences.zh: 燕王不聽，自將偏軍隨之。

translations.literal: The Yan king did not listen and personally led a flank army to follow them.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king did not listen and personally led a flank army to follow them.

sentences.zh: 將渠引燕王綬止之曰：「王必無自往，往無成功。」

translations.literal: Jiang Qu pulled the Yan king's sash to stop him, saying: "The king must not go personally. If you go, there will be no success."
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Qu pulled the Yan king's sash to stop him, saying: "The king must not go personally. If you go, there will be no success."

sentences.zh: 王蹵之以足。

translations.literal: The king kicked him with his foot.
translations.idiomatic: The king kicked him with his foot.

sentences.zh: 將渠泣曰：「臣非以自為，為王也！」

translations.literal: Jiang Qu wept and said: "Your servant is not doing this for himself, but for the king!"
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Qu wept and said: "Your servant is not doing this for himself, but for the king!"

sentences.zh: 燕軍至宋子，趙使廉頗將，擊破栗腹於鄗。

translations.literal: The Yan army reached Songzi. Zhao sent Lian Po as general, who attacked and defeated Li Fu at Hao.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan army reached Songzi. Zhao sent Lian Po as general, who attacked and defeated Li Fu at Hao.

sentences.zh: ［樂乘］破卿秦（樂乘）於代。

translations.literal: Yue Cheng defeated Qing Qin at Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Cheng defeated Qing Qin at Dai.

sentences.zh: 樂閒奔趙。

translations.literal: Yue Jian fled to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Jian fled to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 廉頗逐之五百餘里，圍其國。

translations.literal: Lian Po pursued them for more than five hundred li and besieged their state.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po pursued them for more than five hundred li and besieged their state.

sentences.zh: 燕人請和，趙人不許，必令將渠處和。

translations.literal: The people of Yan requested peace. The people of Zhao did not permit it, insisting that Jiang Qu handle the peace negotiations.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Yan requested peace. The people of Zhao did not permit it, insisting that Jiang Qu handle the peace negotiations.

sentences.zh: 燕相將渠以處和。

translations.literal: The Yan prime minister Jiang Qu handled the peace negotiations.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan prime minister Jiang Qu handled the peace negotiations.

sentences.zh: 趙聽將渠，解燕圍。

translations.literal: Zhao listened to Jiang Qu and lifted the siege of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao listened to Jiang Qu and lifted the siege of Yan.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦滅東（西）周，置三川郡。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin destroyed Eastern Zhou and established the Sanchuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin destroyed Eastern Zhou and established the Sanchuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦拔趙榆次三十七城，秦置大原郡。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qin captured thirty-seven cities from Zhao at Yuci. Qin established the Taiyuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin captured thirty-seven cities from Zhao at Yuci. Qin established the Taiyuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 九年，秦王政初即位。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, the King of Qin, Zheng, first ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, King Zheng of Qin first ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十年，趙使廉頗將攻繁陽，拔之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Zhao sent Lian Po as general to attack Fanyang and captured it.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhao sent Lian Po as general to attack Fanyang and captured it.

sentences.zh: 趙孝成王卒，悼襄王立。

translations.literal: King Xiaocheng of Zhao died, and King Daoxiang succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiaocheng of Zhao died, and King Daoxiang succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 使樂乘代廉頗，廉頗不聽，攻樂乘，樂乘走，廉頗奔大梁。

translations.literal: They sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po. Lian Po did not obey, attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled, and Lian Po fled to Daliang.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po. Lian Po did not obey and attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled, and Lian Po fled to the city of Daliang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，趙使李牧攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan and captured Wusui and Fangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan and captured Wusui and Fangcheng.

sentences.zh: 劇辛故居趙，與龐煖善，已而亡走燕。

translations.literal: Ju Xin had formerly lived in Zhao and was friendly with Pang Nuan, but then fled to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Ju Xin had formerly lived in the state of Zhao and was friendly with Pang Nuan, but then fled to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕見趙數困于秦，而廉頗去，令龐煖將也，欲因趙獘攻之。

translations.literal: Yan saw that Zhao had been repeatedly hard pressed by Qin, and Lian Po had left, so they made Pang Nuan general. They wished to take advantage of Zhao's weakness to attack it.
translations.idiomatic: Yan saw that Zhao had been repeatedly hard pressed by Qin, and Lian Po had left, so they made Pang Nuan the general. They wished to take advantage of Zhao's weakness to attack it.

sentences.zh: 問劇辛，辛曰：「龐煖易與耳。」

translations.literal: They asked Ju Xin. Xin said: "Pang Nuan is easy to deal with."
translations.idiomatic: They asked Ju Xin. Xin said: "Pang Nuan is easy to deal with."

sentences.zh: 燕使劇辛將擊趙，趙使龐煖擊之，取燕軍二萬，殺劇辛。

translations.literal: Yan sent Ju Xin as general to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Pang Nuan to attack him, captured twenty thousand Yan soldiers, and killed Ju Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Yan sent Ju Xin as the general to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Pang Nuan to attack him, captured twenty thousand Yan soldiers, and killed Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 秦拔魏二十城，置東郡。

translations.literal: Qin captured twenty cities from Wei and established the Dong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured twenty cities from Wei and established the Dong commandery.

sentences.zh: 十九年，秦拔趙之鄴九城。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured nine cities from Zhao at Ye.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured nine cities from Zhao at Ye.

sentences.zh: 趙悼襄王卒。

translations.literal: King Daoxiang of Zhao died.
translations.idiomatic: King Daoxiang of Zhao died.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，太子丹質於秦，亡歸燕。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the heir apparent Dan was a hostage in Qin and fled back to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, the heir apparent Dan, who was a hostage in Qin, fled back to Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，秦虜滅韓王安，置潁川郡。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin captured and destroyed King An of Han and established the Yingchuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin captured and destroyed King An of Han and established the Yingchuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，秦虜趙王遷，滅趙。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao and destroyed Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao and destroyed Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉自立為代王。

translations.literal: Zhao's Prince Jia established himself as King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao's Prince Jia established himself as King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 燕見秦且滅六國，秦兵臨易水，禍且至燕。

translations.literal: Yan saw that Qin was about to destroy the six states. Qin's army reached the Yi River, and disaster was about to come to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Yan saw that Qin was about to destroy the six states. Qin's army reached the Yi River, and disaster was about to come to Yan.

sentences.zh: 太子丹陰養壯士二十人，使荊軻獻督亢地圖於秦，因襲刺秦王。

translations.literal: The heir apparent Dan secretly raised twenty brave men and sent Jing Ke to present the Dukang map to Qin, then took advantage of this to assassinate the King of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The heir apparent Dan secretly raised twenty brave men and sent Jing Ke to present the Dukang map to Qin, then took advantage of this to assassinate the King of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺，殺軻，使將軍王翦擊燕。

translations.literal: The King of Qin detected it, killed Ke, and sent General Wang Jian to attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin detected it, killed Ke, and sent General Wang Jian to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦攻拔我薊，燕王亡，徙居遼東，斬丹以獻秦。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured our Ji. The Yan king fled, moved to Liaodong, and beheaded Dan to present to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured our Ji. The Yan king fled, moved to Liaodong, and beheaded Dan to present to Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十年，秦滅魏。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Qin destroyed Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin destroyed Wei.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，秦拔遼東，虜燕王喜，卒滅燕。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured Liaodong, captured King Xi of Yan, and finally destroyed Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured Liaodong, captured King Xi of Yan, and finally destroyed Yan.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦將王賁亦虜代王嘉。

translations.literal: That year, the Qin general Wang Ben also captured King Jia of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: That year, the Qin general Wang Ben also captured King Jia of Dai.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：召公奭可謂仁矣！

translations.literal: The Grand Scribe says: The Duke of Shao Shi can be called benevolent!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: The Duke of Shao Shi can be called benevolent!

sentences.zh: 笆棠且思之，況其人乎？

translations.literal: The sweet pear tree is still remembered. How much more the man himself?
translations.idiomatic: The sweet pear tree is still remembered. How much more the man himself?

sentences.zh: 燕（北）［外］迫蠻貉，內措齊、晉，崎嶇彊國之閒，最為弱小，幾滅者數矣。

translations.literal: Yan was externally pressed by the Man and Mo, internally placed between Qi and Jin, struggling between powerful states. It was the weakest and smallest, and was nearly destroyed several times.
translations.idiomatic: Yan was externally pressed by the Man and Mo, internally placed between Qi and Jin, struggling between powerful states. It was the weakest and smallest, and was nearly destroyed several times.

sentences.zh: 然社稷血食者八九百歲，於姬姓獨後亡，豈非召公之烈邪！

translations.literal: However, the altars of state received blood sacrifices for eight or nine hundred years. Among the Ji surname, it alone perished last. Was this not the achievement of the Duke of Shao!
translations.idiomatic: However, the altars of state received blood sacrifices for eight or nine hundred years. Among the Ji surname, it alone perished last. Was this not the achievement of the Duke of Shao!
